snippet: A five-judge panel in Manhattan must determine if the company can intervene when it believes the government’s request tramples on the right of customers to be protected from unreasonable searches.
abstract: New York State appeals court in Manhattan is set hear case that tackles issue of Internet privacy; case, being closely watched by civil libertarians and social media companies, involves search warrants that allowed Manhattan prosecutors to seize Facebook accounts of 300 people who had not been charged with a crime; court will also determine whether Facebook has right to challenge warrants.
lead_paragraph: A five-judge panel in Manhattan must determine if the company can intervene when it believes the government’s request tramples on the right of customers to be protected from unreasonable searches.

headline.main: Court Weighs Facebook’s Right to Challenge Search Warrants on Users’ Behalf
headline.print_headline: Court Weighs Facebook’s Right to Challenge Search Warrants on Users’ Behalf
